cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles E of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest toward the southeastern North Carolina coast, then forecast to drift west and turn north across the Carolinas and the central Appalachians early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in Virginia (Hurricane Watch remains only Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA, including lower Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern North Carolina, southeastern Virginia, and portions of the mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (2–4 ft possible, locally higher in tidal inlets)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt gusts) possible Friday night through Monday, highest in squalls from the southeast
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along the lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent rivers
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with locally higher amounts could lead to flash and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, periods of restricted visibility, and minor coastal inundation may disrupt port operations
